Please introduce the AWGN channelThe AWGN channel, or Additive White Gaussian Noise channel, is the most fundamental model in communication theory. It is defined by three key properties: the noise is additive, meaning it is simply summed with the signal; it is white, which refers to its flat power spectral density across all frequencies; and it is Gaussian, as its amplitude follows a normal distribution. This model is crucial because its mathematical simplicity makes it an ideal tool for analyzing the theoretical performance limits of communication systems.ä¹Ÿç®—æ˜¯ç£•ç£•å·´å·´ç­”å…¨äº†ï¼Œä½†è€å¸ˆèƒ½ä¸èƒ½å¬æ‡‚æ˜¯å¦å¤–ä¸€å›äº‹

\(\mathbf{A}\mathbf{X}-\lambda\mathbf{I}\mathbf{X}=(\mathbf{A}-\lambda\mathbf{I})\mathbf{X}=\mathbf{0}\)
